dct_description_sm: This has additions to the Pacific Islands and to New England, including the insertion of Pensilvania (thus 1682 is earliest possible date for map). Imprint: Sold at ye Atlas in Cornhill & at ye Globe in ye Strand London. Issued in: Atlas maritimus / John Thornton, 1685. Bound for presentation to James II.
First issued in 1676. Reproduced in: The Blathwayt atlas, maps and commentary / by Jeanette D. Black. -- Providence, 1970-75.

California as an island with indented northern coast. Anian and Strate of Anian lightly drawn. Includes Terra de Ieffo and Zelandia Nova. Dedication within nautical cartouche and below a crest: To Capt: John Wood this Map of the WORLD Drawn acording to Mercators Projection is humbly Dedicated By Robt. Morden & Willm. Berry Sold at ye Atlas in Cornhill & at ye Globe in ye Strand London. (bottom center). Inset: Polar projection to approx. 47 deg. N. lat. (upper left).
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
